summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding Deutsche Bank's document production in response to a subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein's accounts. The email discusses the status of document production and requests a meeting to discuss the nature of Epstein's accounts and activities.

persons.name: Thomas Moyer
persons.context: Attorney from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP who sent the document production on behalf of Deutsche Bank and is being followed up with regarding the status and meeting.

persons.name: Parvin Moyne
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding Deutsche Bank's document production related to Epstein.

persons.name: Andrew Stemmer
persons.context: Copied on the email as someone previously discussed with regarding Deutsche Bank's document production related to Epstein.

persons.name: Benjamin, James
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email from Thomas Moyer regarding Deutsche Bank's document production and the follow-up inquiry.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose accounts and activities at Deutsche Bank are the subject of the subpoena and document production discussed in the email.

connections.description: Thomas Moyer is acting on behalf of Deutsche Bank, their client, in responding to a subpoena and producing documents.
Engaged in email correspondence regarding the status of document production related to Jeffrey Epstein's accounts at Deutsche Bank.
Both are recipients/correspondents in the email chain regarding Deutsche Bank's document production.
Epstein held accounts at Deutsche Bank, which are the subject of a subpoena and document production.

events.title: Subpoena issued to Deutsche Bank
events.description: A subpoena was issued to Deutsche Bank, likely by a prosecutor's office, requesting documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's accounts.

events.title: Deutsche Bank document production
events.description: Deutsche Bank, through its attorney Thomas Moyer, produced an additional set of documents in response to the July 11 subpoena.

events.title: Follow-up on document production and meeting request
events.description: An email follow-up inquiring about the status of document production and requesting a meeting to discuss the nature of Epstein's accounts and activities at Deutsche Bank.

locations: 2001 K Street N.W., Washington, DC 20006 (Akin Gump office)
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was responding to a subpoena dated July 11, 2019, related to Jeffrey Epstein's accounts.
An attorney for Deutsche Bank, Thomas Moyer, produced documents on July 30, 2019, and was followed up with on August 1, 2019, regarding the status and a potential meeting.
The correspondence indicates an active investigation into the nature and activities of Jeffrey Epstein's financial accounts at Deutsche Bank.
The document production was secured and shared via Citrix Files, with an expiration date of January 26, 2020.
The email chain involves multiple legal professionals, indicating a coordinated legal and investigative effort regarding Epstein's finances.
